toolclip.text: Renders the scene in the Render View window. (%(currentRendererName)s).

toolclip.title: IPR render the current frame
toolclip.text: Renders the scene using the Interactive Photorealistic Renderer. (%(currentRendererName)s)

toolclip.title: Exposure
toolclip.text:
Adjust the brightness for display. Click the icon to toggle between the default and modified values. Lowering the exposure allows you to view detail that is not visible in highlights by default.
In addition to typing a value or using the slider, you can: - Press Ctrl+Minus to decrease by fine increments. - Press Ctrl+Alt+Minus to decrease by coarse increments. - Press Ctrl+= to increase by fine increments. - Press Ctrl+Alt+= to increase by coarse increments. - Click in the numeric box, then Ctrl+drag with the middle mouse button.

toolclip.title: Gamma
toolclip.text:
Adjust the contrast, or brightness of the midtones in the image for display. Click the icon to toggle between the default and modified values. Increasing the gamma allows you to see details in the shadows of your image.
In addition to typing a value or using the slider, you can: - Press Ctrl+; to decrease by fine increments. - Press Ctrl+Alt+; to decrease by coarse increments. - Press Ctrl+' to increase by fine increments. - Press Ctrl+Alt+' to increase by coarse increments. - Click in the numeric box, then Ctrl+drag with the middle mouse button.

toolclip.title: View Transform
toolclip.text: The view transform converts color values from the rendering color space for display. Click the icon to temporarily toggle the view transform off and display the raw rendering space values for diagnostic or other reasons. You can also temporarily select a different view transform from the list.
